properties.areaDesc: Crawford, IL; Sullivan, IN; Clark, IL; Vigo, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Terre Haute.
* from Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* At  7:30 AM Friday the stage was 8.3 feet. This is 2.0 to 2.5 feet
higher than the observations from the old legacy gauge.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet. This is 2.5 feet higher than flood stage
from the old legacy gauge.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 25.6 feet by late Sunday night.
* At 26.0 feet...A few agricultural levees fail. Water enters about 50
homes in the North Lake, Izaak Walton, South Lake areas and near
Fort Harrison Country Club. Some evacuations are necessary.
Significant flooding in progress of industrial area on east bank
near I-70. Backwater extends up Lost Creek to Lafayette Street.
Land on west side of U.S. 150 and railroad tracks begins to flood.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
